original_title: X-Press Pearl disaster: SC calls for progress report on compensation payment
original_body_lines: The Supreme Court today directed the Attorney General to submit a progress report regarding the awarding of compensation to the fishermen who were severely affected by the X-Press Pearl disaster.

The Supreme Court made this direction pursuant to submissions made by counsel who appeared on behalf of the petitioners to the effect that the victims of the X-Press disaster have not been paid since November last year.

Counsel Himali Kularatne appearing for Rev. Fr. Sarath Iddamalgoda and the fishermen representing Negombo and Chilaw submitted to the court that the victims have not received compensation since November, 2022.
The Supreme Court four-judge-bench headed by Supreme Court Justice Murdu Fernando fixed the petitions to be heard on October 5 and 6.

The Center for Environmental Justice (CEJ), Rev. Fr. Sarath Iddamalgoda and fishermen representing Negombo and Chilaw had filed Fundamental Rights petitions seeking an order directing the respondents to award compensation to the fishermen who were severely affected by the X-Press Pearl disaster. (Lakmal Sooriyagoda)
